DataElement.preferredName: Blood Supply Cutoff From Tumor Tissue Excision Performed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date on which the blood supply for the tumor tissue being submitted was cut off.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Blood Supply Cutoff From Tumor Tissue Excision Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood._Supply what is desired or needed._A designated limit beyond which something cannot function or must be terminated._Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument._A tissue sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination._The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ._Performed; carried out.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Blood Provide Cutoff From Tumor Tissue
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.:Supply what is desired or needed.:A designated limit beyond which something cannot function or must be terminated.:Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument.:A tissue sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
Supply what is desired or needed.
A designated limit beyond which something cannot function, must be terminated, or no longer applies.
Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument.

Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Removal or excision by surgical measures.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Date blood supply was cut off
ReferenceDocuments.description: Date blood supply was cut off from the tumor tissue being excised
